A drone captured some spectacular footage of the lowest elevation on earth – the Dead Sea.
The 997ft deep hypersaline lake – the deepest in the world – measures 1,407ft below sea level and is one of the saltiest bodies of water on the planet.
Amir Aloni took his drone for a spin over the western region and captured the beauty of Israel as well as some mesmerising footage of the shrinking salt lake.
Stunning aerial views of the Dead Sea by drone The 997ft deep hypersaline lake measures 1,407ft below sea level and is one of the world's saltiest bodies of water
The drone captured the beauty of Israel as well as some mesmerising footage of the shrinking salt lake
The first measurements of the Dead Sea were taken in 1927 and since then the water levels have continually declined.
It is believed that more water has flowed out of and evaporated from the sea than has entered it from the Jordan River and that this is the reason for the levels dropping.

Owner has absolutely priceless reaction to pet cat climbing... 127 shares The Israeli Geological Institute of Limnological Research are monitoring the levels with a small research buoy that floats in the centre of the sea and measures its depth.
The marker measures the water level near the Dead Sea coastal resort of Ein Gedi, Israel.
The first measurements of the Dead Sea were taken in 1927 and since then the water levels have continually declined
It is believed that more water has flowed out of the sea than has entered it from the Jordan River, causing the levels to drop
The Israeli Geological Institute of Limnological Research are monitoring the water levels of the Dead Sea with a small research buoy
The salt water of the Dead Sea is said to have a number of healing properties and people bathe in it to reap the benefits
The drone captured beautiful landscape imagery of the huge expanse of salty water and its surrounding coastline
Captured on the drone is beautiful landscape imagery of the water and its surrounding coastline.
The unmanned aerial vehicle also captured the magnitude of the place as well as its sense of isolation.
Gliding over the water, the camera filmed people relaxing in the salt lake – its water is said to have a number of healing properties.
Later in the video a caravan of camels feature standing on a pathway leading to the water.
The clip concluded on a shot of a man floating in the salt lake – something that is relatively easy to do in the Dead Sea as the water is very dense.
